TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IScatteringByteChannel implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.IO.ICloseable, class Java.Nio.Channels.IChannel, class Java.Nio.Channels.IReadableByteChannel, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: The interface for channels that can read data into a set of buffers in a single operation.

remarks.para: The interface for channels that can read data into a set of buffers in a single operation. The corresponding interface for writes is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 Read(class Java.Nio.ByteBuffer[] buffers) cil managed

Docs.param: the array of byte buffers to store the bytes being read.
Docs.summary: Reads bytes from this channel into the specified array of buffers.

remarks.para: Reads bytes from this channel into the specified array of buffers.
This method is equivalent to read(buffers, 0, buffers.length);

Docs.exception: if the channel is closed by another thread during this read operation.
if another thread interrupts the calling thread while the operation is in progress. The interrupt state of the calling thread is set and the channel is closed.
if another I/O error occurs; details are in the message.
if the channel has not been opened in a mode that permits reading.

MemberSignature.Value: public long Read (Java.Nio.ByteBuffer[] buffers, int offset, int length);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 Read(class Java.Nio.ByteBuffer[] buffers, int32 offset, int32 length) cil managed

Docs.param: the array of byte buffers into which the bytes will be copied.
the index of the first buffer to store bytes in.
the maximum number of buffers to store bytes in.
Docs.summary: Attempts to read all remaining() bytes from length byte buffers, in order, starting at buffers[offset].

remarks.para: Attempts to read all remaining() bytes from length byte buffers, in order, starting at buffers[offset]. The number of bytes actually read is returned.
If a read operation is in progress, subsequent threads will block until the read is completed and will then contend for the ability to read.

Docs.exception: if the channel is closed by another thread during this read operation.
if another thread interrupts the calling thread while the operation is in progress. The interrupt state of the calling thread is set and the channel is closed.
if offset or length , or if offset + length is greater than the size of buffers.
if another I/O error occurs; details are in the message.
if the channel has not been opened in a mode that permits reading.
